Title: The China Syndrome
Cast: Jane Fonda, Jack Lemmon, Michael Douglas, Scott Brady, James Hampton, Peter Donat, Wilford Brimley, Richard Herd, Daniel Valdez, Stan Bohrman, James Karen, Michael Alaimo, Donald Hotton, Khalilah Ali, Paul Larson
Plot: A reporter finds what appears to be a cover-up of safety hazards at a nuclear power plant. While doing a series of reports on alternative energy sources, an opportunistic reporter Kimberly Wells witnesses an accident at a nuclear power plant. Wells is determined to publicise the incident but soon finds herself entangled in a sinister conspiracy to keep the full impact of the incident a secret. Written by Dave Jenkins <david.jenkins@smallworld.co.uk>
Keywords: radiation, power plant, geiger counter, power, nuclear power plant
Awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 7 wins & 11 nominations.
Location: Sunset Gower Studios, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA
Actors: Jane Fonda, Jack Lemmon, Michael Douglas
Writer: Mike Gray, T.S. Cook | 1 more credit »
Description: Directed by James Bridges.  With Jane Fonda, Jack Lemmon, Michael Douglas, Scott Brady. A reporter finds what appears to be a cover-up of safety hazards at a nuclear power plant.
